post.body:
[that’s](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EErueQdEXMA&t=3m4s) why progressive webapps are importent for your startup
* 80 % of time spent is in user’s top 3 apps
* 0 new apps will be installed per month
that means [nobody whant’s your app](https://medium.com/swlh/nobody-wants-your-app-6af1f7f69cb7)

the principle of “the app store” is a star system and your app will be placed in the [long tail](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_tail)

0 new app installs per month means no one is search for new apps in the app store, that means nobody will find you

people seaching in the web! so show your answer/solution in the web, and let them install your website if the want

### How Emoji Can Improve Your Code—Seriously (ﾉ◕ヮ◕)ﾉ*:･ﾟ✧

https://www.tjvantoll.com/2016/06/10/emoji-and-coding

* [Emoticons table](http://apps.timwhitlock.info/emoji/tables/unicode)
* [Unicode Emojis](http://unicode-table.com/de/search/?q=emoji) [1](http://emojipedia.org/unicode-8.0) [2](https://gist.github.com/endolith/157796)
* [all japanese emoticons](http://japaneseemoticons.me/all-japanese-emoticons)

### Git How-To: Remove Your Password from a Repository

```
$ git filter-branch --tree-filter “find . -type f -exec sed -i -e ‘s/originalpassword/newpassword/g’ {} ;”
```

http://www.davidverhasselt.com/git-how-to-remove-your-password-from-a-repository

### [Rumble](http://disruptedsystems.org) a offgrid meshnetworking microblogging/chat app for Android
who synchronize posts via Bluetooth or Wifi in Groups

usefull on:

* mass events like concerts or congresses, when the network goes down
* demonstrations, when police forces track or block the GSM traffic
* group holliday in desert places

### Base-122 – A space efficient alternative to base-64
Hacker News Comments: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=13049329

Source: http://blog.kevinalbs.com/base122

### I'm playing around with [STORJ.io](https://storj.io)
**Storj** is a **startup** in **Atlanta US**, and they [want ](https://medium.com/@storjproject/storj-master-plan-45bfb63c6b38?source=user_profile---------1---------) to provide you a > *Blockchain-based, end-to-end encrypted, distributed object storage, where only you have access to your data.* **means:** this is a decentralized cloud storage you can participate as host and earn coins or [integrate in your app](https://storj.io/developers.html) via a JS API
to participate as host, you can download a GUI or CLI client * https://storj.io/share.html * https://github.com/Storj/storjshare-cli **two steps are important** for the configuraion of the client 1) you need a counter walled, [look here for a guidance](http://cryptomining-blog.com/6401-trying-out-the-latest-version-of-storj-driveshare-gui) 2) you need to provide a working port transfaire * if you **enabled UPnP** on your **router** you can use the client without some extra configurations * **if not**, you need to set some [port forwards](http://docs.storj.io/docs/storjshare-troubleshooting-guide#port-forwarding) I configured a 580 GB share and nothing happens for hours but after a night the share was filled with 1.004 GB, so have some patience #### Some answered questions * [How much will I make from DriveShare?](http://blog.storj.io/post/110416906278/how-much-will-i-make-from-driveshare) * [How to set storage price](https://docs.storj.io/v1.0/discuss/57f1d6ff1d89490e003b28a5) - tldr; you can't (for now) * [Why am I not getting paid?](https://docs.storj.io/v1.0/discuss/580daa01c7fe7d0f00e0b776) - tldr: you will, end of month (for now) #### Similiar Projects * [Maidsafe](http://maidsafe.net) -> ([Vault](https://github.com/maidsafe/safe_vault)) - a startup in london * read the [blog](https://blog.maidsafe.net/tag/vault-2) * or search on [youtube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r9MHr0zkIyk) * [Ethereum](https://www.ethereum.org) -> [Swarm](https://github.com/ethersphere/swarm) - startup in kanton Zug, Switzerland * [What is Swarm](https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/questions/375/what-is-swarm-and-what-is-it-used-for) - [Article](http://www.coinfox.info/news/5472-poverkh-ethereum-budet-postroena-platforma-detsentralizovannogo-khraneniya-dannykh-swarm-2) * [swarm-gateways.net](http://swarm-gateways.net/bzz:/swarm) * [FileCoin](http://filecoin.io) - no releases yet * [Sia](https://sia.tech) - need to transfaire some BTC to start sharing your drives - bääääää * [Codius](https://codius.org/docs/overview/for-hosting) - maybe ?
